title: Slingshot Aerospace completes $40.8 million funding round
summary: Slingshot Aerospace announced Dec. 6 it has raised $40.8 million in a Series A2 funding round.

title: Orion swings by the moon on its way back to Earth
summary: NASA’s Orion spacecraft flew by the moon for a second and final time Dec. 5, performing a maneuver that sets up the spacecraft for a splashdown in the Pacific Ocean in six days.

title: Advisory panel to examine DoD’s demand for commercial space systems
summary: The Pentagon’s top research official has directed the Defense Science Board to examine the military’s growing reliance on commercial space technology and its implications.

title: Ukraine’s Promin Aerospace on track for 2023 flight test
summary: Ukrainian startup Promin Aerospace remains on track to conduct the first test of its small satellite launch technology early next year, in spite of the ongoing Russian-Ukrainian war.

title: Artemis 1 capsule beams back spectacular farewell views of the moon
summary: Flying just 80 miles off the lunar surface, NASA’s Orion capsule fired its main engine Monday to slingshot around the moon and set a course for splashdown Dec. 11 in the Pacific Ocean to complete the Artemis 1 test flight. The unpiloted spacecraft relayed home ethereal real-time views of the moon’s cratered surface and a crescent Earth suspended in the blackness of space a quarter-million miles away.
